  • server.queue_manager module

server.queue_manager module¶

This module contains following classes: QueueManager, QueueClient, QueueServer.

You can run this module directly to start the server. The server bind to address and port, which are specified in settings.

$ python queue_manager.py
class QueueManager[source]¶

Bases: object

This class holds and manage all queues.

Note

Do not use this class directly. Instead use QueueClient to connect to the QueueServer and get an instance of this class.

next_host()[source]¶

Getting next hostname from the appropriate queue.

Return str:hostname e.g. “google.com”
empty_queue()[source]¶
Empty entire queue.

Note

use this function with care. it will empty the whole host_queue. even if the host_queue has not finished yet.

put_user(user_request, user_id)[source]¶

Function will store any user requested urls to _user_queue and ready the _user_result_dict for an incoming sslyze result corresponding to user_id

Parameters:
  • user_request (list) – the url requested to be checked by sslyze
  • user_id – unique user identifier corresponding to the request
put_new_list(new_list, from_dump=False)[source]¶

Empty and refill the queue.

Parameters:
  • new_list (list) – nested list with hostname and source e.g. [ [“google.com”, [“alexa-top-1m”, ] ], ]
  • from_dump (bool) – should be set to True if function call is used to fill the queue from dump
next_result()[source]¶

Getting next result from result_queue.

Return tuple:({sslyze result}, [source,])
get_user_result(user_id)[source]¶

Function will get and return the result corresponding to the supplied user_id

Parameters:user_id – the user_id to identify which result to get
Returns:the sslyze result

Note

_inner_result_queue is a local field and will not be available beyond this function There will be only one sslyze result per user_id

put_result(result)[source]¶

Adding a result to result_queue. :param result: the sslyze result to pe added to the _result.queue

put_user_result(result, user_id)[source]¶

Function will will add an sslyze result to the _user_result_dict :param result: the sslyze result to be added :param user_id: the user identifier for the corresponding result .. note:: _inner_result_queue is a local field and will not be available beyond

this function There will be only one sslyze result per user_id
status()[source]¶
class QueueClient(address=('localhost', 50001), authkey='abc')[source]¶

Bases: multiprocessing.managers.BaseManager

This class is used to connect to QueueServer.

If you instantiate this class it will auto connect to the server. So you can get an instance by name of each registered object.

Example: 
from queue_manager import QueueClient

c = QueueClient()

# registered name is "queue_manager" , so you can call it to get
# the instance of QueueManager class.
queue_manager = c.queue_manager()

# do something with queue_manager ...
